citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)
citeinfo.title: Coastal & Oceanic Plankton Ecology, Production & Observation Database (COPEPOD)

abstract.p: Coastal & Oceanic Plankton Ecology, Production & Observation Database (COPEPOD) is a global plankton database. COPEPOD offers in situ zooplankton and phytoplankton abundance, biomass, and composition data at three processing levels: Level 1) Data Subsets containing data and summaries based on the original cruise, project, or institute data collections; Level 2) Data Compilations containing a compiled collections of all data within COPEPOD for various taxonomic groups; and Level 3) Data Products containing calculated mean fields of annual and seasonal mean biomass or abundance.
[Reference: O'Brien, T.D. 2004. COPEPOD: The Coastal & Oceanic Plankton Ecology, Production & Observation Database [Online]. Available: http://www.st.nmfs.noaa.gov/plankton.]

purpose.p: COPEPOD is an effort by NOAA - National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS) to provide investigators with an integrated data set of quality-controlled, globally distributed plankton abundance, biomass and composition data, along with co-sampled environmental data. COPEPOD is designed to help the investigator easily see exactly what data are currently available and then download it in a usable format. In additional to data distribution maps, COPEPOD offers a variety of content summaries and searching options.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
